title: Programming Language Design and Implementation
description: We study the theory of programming languages and their implementation.  Topics may include automata, semantics, verification, interpreters, compilers, and runtime systems.  This course includes a substantial project.
prerequisite: YSC2229 Introductory Data Structures and Algorithms (or previously YSC2204 Fundamentals of Programming) or with the permission of the instructor.
preclusion: YSC3208 Programming Language Design and Implementation
corequisite: YSC3207 Principles and Tools of Software Development or with the permission of the instructor.
